title: Temporary Withdrawal of All Areas on the Outer Continental Shelf From Offshore Wind Leasing and Review of the Federal Government's Leasing and Permitting Practices for Wind Projects
summary:
The memorandum dated January 20, 2025, outlines a temporary withdrawal of all areas on the Outer Continental Shelf (OCS) from offshore wind leasing. This decision, effective January 21, 2025, aims to balance energy needs with environmental and economic considerations, including marine life protection and maintaining a robust fishing industry. The withdrawal prevents new or renewed wind energy leases but does not affect existing leases.

Additionally, the memorandum mandates a comprehensive review of federal wind leasing and permitting practices, halting new approvals for onshore and offshore wind projects until this assessment is complete. The review will examine environmental impacts on wildlife and economic costs associated with wind energy generation. 

The document also addresses specific concerns regarding the Lava Ridge Wind Project, proposing a temporary moratorium on its activities and a new analysis of its environmental implications. A report on the impact of defunct windmills on surrounding communities is also required.

Overall, this memorandum reflects a cautious approach to wind energy development, prioritizing environmental assessments and community impacts over immediate expansion in offshore wind leasing.
